concept_data.title: member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.preferred_term: member of the European Central Bank

summary: A "member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank" is a pivotal figure within the governance structure of the European Central Bank (ECB), which is the central bank for the eurozone. This role entails significant responsibilities in monetary policy formulation and implementation, financial stability oversight, and the management of the ECB's operational framework. The term redirects to "member of the European Central Bank," emphasizing the broader context of ECB membership. Members are appointed based on their expertise in economic and financial matters, contributing to the regulatory landscape that underpins the EU's economic governance and integration.

metadata.category: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service
